Eric Schmidt said Google had considered stopping indexing confidential cables released by WikiLeaks, but had decided to carry on. Some other U.S. organizations have bowed to government pressure to stop cooperating with the controversial site. Has Google looked at the appropriateness of indexing WikiLeaks? The answer is yes, and we decided to continue, he said. "Because it's legal."( Reporting by Georgina Prodhan; Editing by Jane Merriman and Jon Loades-Carter)

Meanwhile, some are suggesting that Eric Schmidt is walking away now because he senses that Google's fortunes have peaked. Along with the continued rise of Facebook and Twitter, InformationWeek notes: He is stepping aside just as Google spins the wheel on its riskiest bet yet: the launch of Chrome OS, the company's Web-based operating system.
